author: samwilsn
content: All stack arguments are 256-bit values, usually unsigned integers.

author: xinbenlv
content: Is it a good idea to explicitly call out the size of operands in the EIP e.g. EIP-7? I can send a PR to update EIP-7 but just wanna run the idea through this group first

author: samwilsn
content:
I don't think it's necessary for opcodes pulling from the stack. The EVM is a 256-bit word machine.

If your argument is anything other than a 256-bit unsigned integer, then yes, you should specify that.

author: pandapip1
content:
We've bypassed codespell for now. Codespell passes even though it prints errors.

I agree though, we need a more permanent solution.
